method.input: Genomic sequence and NCBI non-redundant protein database
method.output: BLASTX alignments
method.description: WU-BLASTX is used to identify statistically significant DNA-protein sequence similarities found between DNA sequence queries and protein sequence libraries
method.credit: Warren R. Gish, Washington University, Saint Louis, Missouri

method.input: FASTA file of protein sequences and PFAM database
method.description: Searches HMMs from the PFAM database for significantly similar sequences in the input protein sequence.

method.input: output of megablast analysis of a fasta formatted transcript file with a genomic sequence database formatted using formatdb
method.output: a tab-delimited text with every line representing a separate segment on the query sequence.
method.description: Splign uses transcript to genomic sequence BLAST hit output to generate information about exon-intron boundaries, splice-junctions, potential frameshifts, and alternative models when there is more than one possibility

method.displayName: BLASTP Annotated protein sequences vs. NRDB
method.output: BLASTP alignments
method.description: BLASTP translations of annotated genes against NCBI non-redundant protein database. WU-BLASTP is used to identify statistically significant protein-protein sequence similarities
method.credit: Warren R. Gish, Washington University, Saint Louis, Missouri

method.displayName: BLASTP translated protein sequences vs. PDB
method.output: BLASTP alignments
method.description: BLASTP translations of annotated genes against the Protein Data Bank. WU-BLASTP is used to identify statistically significant protein-protein sequence similarities
method.credit: Warren R. Gish, Washington University, Saint Louis, Missouri

method.output: Predicted transmembrane domain topology
method.description: TMHMM is used to predict transmembrane domain presence and topology
method.credit: Anders Krogh, Bjorn Larsson, Gunnar von Heijne, and Erik L.L. Sonnhammer

method.output: Signal peptide predictions
method.description: SignalP is used to identify signal peptides and their likely cleavage sites.
method.credit: Bendtsen JD, Nielsen H, von Heijne G, Brunak S.

method.input: Oligo sequences and Genomic or transcript sequences
method.output: BLASTN alignments
method.description: WU-BLASTN is used to identify statistically signficant DNA sequence similarities found between DNA sequence queries and DNA sequence libraries
method.credit: Warren R. Gish, Washington University, Saint Louis, Missouri

method.output: file containing export sequences and scores
method.description: Program that predicts the exported proteins of Plasmodium.

method.displayName: Find tandem repeats in genomic sequence
method.output: a repeat table file and an alignment file
method.description: The Tandem Repeats Finder program locates and displays tandem repeats in DNA sequences

method.output: Protein sequences containing regions of low complexity are masked with the character 'x'
method.description: seg was used to mask low complexity regions.

method.output: Genomic sequences containing regions of low complexity are masked with the character 'N'
method.description: dust was used to mask low complexity regions.

method.input: Protein translations of annotated genes (filtered with seg)
method.output: Residue by residue prediction of helix, strand, and coil accompanied by confidence level
method.description: Psipred predicts secondary structure using a neural network analysis of PSI-BLAST output
method.credit: Jones DT.(1999)Protein secondary structure prediction based on position-specific scoring matrices.J.Mol.Biol.292:195-202.

method.input: Transcript or genomic sequence file in fasta format
method.output: tab delimited file with the type of tRNA, anticodon, score, and locations on the sequences analyzed
method.description: tRNAscan-SE identifies transfer RNA genes in genomic DNA or RNA sequences.

method.input: Protein translations of annotated genes and the InterPro Domains Database
method.output: Domains matched, description of the interpro entry, GO description of the Interpro entry and E-value of the match
method.description: InterProScan scans protein sequences against the protein signatures of the InterPro member databases including PROSITE, PRINTS, xPfam, ProDom,SMART, TIGRFAMs, PIR, SUPERFAMILY

method.output: gff file containing the 6 reading frame, 50 or more amino acid translations of the input nucleic acid
method.description: The translations in all 6 reading frames do not necessarily begin with MET but always end at a stop codon. ORF names are in the form template-frame-start-end, e.g. AAEL01000396-5-5847-4366

method.output: assembled consensus sequence and quality values
method.description: CAP4 is used to generate the EST assemblies. CAP4 aligns and assembles clustered sequence reads and produces consensus sequences

method.input: Fasta file of EST sequences blocked using repeatMasker with RepBase and genome sequences in nib format
method.output: Text file of alignments in .psl format
method.description: ESTs are clustered based on BLAT alignmnets. BLAT is a tool to rapidly find mRNA/DNA alignments that can be run using the GfClient program to query an indexed DNA database on a GfServer

method.input: genomes, exon coordinates, and a phylogentic newick tree
method.output: file of pairwise synteny alignments with defined spans
method.description: Mercator and Mavid are used for comparative genome analysis. Mercator uses genomes and exon coordinates to create exon translations for protein BLAT alignments and outputs orthology maps. The orthology maps are used as a guide for Mavid which also uses a phylogentic newick tree to generate gene alignments

method.input: Fasta file of nucleic acid sequences and RepBase
method.output: Fasta file of masked nucleic acid sequences
method.description: RepeatMasker uses cross-match and a RepBase repeat library to screen DNA sequences for interspersed repeats and low complexity DNA sequences and outputs a modified version of the query sequence in which all the repeats have been masked.

method.output: pI (isoelectric point) values
method.description: The pKa values used to calculate pI are those used in the EMBOSS package; the pI is calculated to only two decimal points.

method.output: Molecular weight values
